channel.title: My Car Story With Lou Page
channel.description: My Car Story With Lou Page

item.title: Classic 1955 Chrysler: Ride in Style
item.description: Step back into the golden age of American motoring with this elegant 1955 Chrysler—a perfect blend of luxury, design, and timeless road presence.

media:content.media:title: Classic 1955 Chrysler: Ride in Style
media:content.media:description: Step back into the golden age of American motoring with this elegant 1955 Chrysler—a perfect blend of luxury, design, and timeless road presence.
media:content.media:credit: My Car Story With Lou Page

item.title: 1958 Buick Special: Yellow & Timeless
item.description: 1958 Buick Special: Yellow & Timeless

item.title: Head-Turning '62 Dodge! Love it or hate it?
item.description: With bold early-’60s styling and classic Mopar character, this 1962 Dodge demands attention—whether you admire its design or find it polarizing.

item.title: Factory 428 Cobra Jet Test Car # 32 of 50 1968 Ford Mustang & Ride
item.description: Number 32 of just 50 built, this 1968 Ford Mustang served as a factory test car for the legendary 428 Cobra Jet engine—offering rare performance and muscle car history in one ride.

item.title: The 1962 Pontiac Catalina
item.description: With bold styling and powerful V8 options, the 1962 Pontiac Catalina embodies early-’60s performance—an icon of Pontiac’s muscle car heritage.

item.title: 1938 Packard Twelve
item.description: A pinnacle of pre-war elegance, the 1938 Packard Twelve blends refined styling with a powerful V12 engine—an enduring symbol of American automotive craftsmanship.

item.title: 2009 Brimstone Quadracycle
item.description: 2009 Brimstone Quadracycle

item.title: Hand-Painted Dukes of Hazzard Engine Art
item.description: A classic motor gets a custom touch with detailed, hand-painted Dukes of Hazzard artwork—blending mechanical power with iconic TV nostalgia.

item.title: 5 Hemis Later, This One Stands Out ��
item.description: Among five legendary Hemi-powered builds, this one takes the spotlight—see what makes it a true standout in muscle car history.

item.title: 1969 Dodge Super Bee with a 426 Hemi
item.description: A rare Yellow Bee edition of the 1969 Dodge Super Bee, powered by the legendary 426 Hemi—classic Mopar muscle at its finest.

item.title: They Only Built 13 of These
item.description: A rare machine from a limited run of just 13 units—discover what makes this model so unique and sought after by collectors.

item.title: 1973 Chevrolet Restomod Showcase
item.description: Classic lines meet modern performance in this 1973 Chevrolet restomod—blending vintage style with upgraded power and comfort.

item.title: 1969 Dart GT Sport in Poly Gold
item.description: A shining example of Mopar style—the 1969 Dart GT Sport dazzles in Poly Gold, blending muscle car performance with classic design.

item.title: Prototype 1978 Cadillac Eldorado
item.description: A unique look at a one-of-a-kind 1978 Cadillac Eldorado prototype, showcasing its design details, luxury features, and place in the brand’s automotive history.

item.title: The Ultimate Barn Find
item.description: Unearthed after years in hiding, this rare discovery shows why barn finds spark so much excitement among collectors and enthusiasts.

item.title: 1964 GT Hawk R2: Rare Supercharged Classic
item.description: One of just ~70 R2‑supercharged GT Hawks built, this 1964 model packs a factory Paxton 289 hp V‑8, disc brakes and bold styling—an ultra‑rare piece of Studebaker performance history.

item.title: 1954 Buick Special With Under 28k Miles!
item.description: This exceptionally low‑mileage 1954 Buick Special (under 28,000 original miles) offers a rare glimpse of a largely untouched survivor—original paint, interior, and operation preserved over decades

item.title: 1967 Belvedere GTX: Mopar Muscle Legend
item.description: A Belvedere turned GTX, packing Plymouth’s 440 Super Commando V8 (375 hp) or the rare 426 Hemi (425 hp). This mid‑size muscle car defined 1967 with serious power and style.

item.title: 426 Hemi So Good He Bought It Twice
item.description: When a 1969 Plymouth Road Runner with the legendary 426 Hemi captured his heart, the owner sold it … and then went out and bought it back. A true testament to a love for Mopar muscle classics.

item.title: Meet the 1963 Pontiac Catalina 421 V8!
item.description: One of only a handful built in 1963, this Pontiac Catalina with the 421 HO V8 and four‑speed manual delivers 370 hp Tri‑Power performance. A true American muscle rarity.
